DOC.brief_summary: Optical Coherence Tomography ( OCT ) technology use harmless near infra-red light scatter produce image . Prior study OCT demonstrate OCT uterine cervix differentiate grade pre-invasive invasive cervical disease cancer . This study evaluate ability NIRIS 1300e imaging ( OCT ) system detect pre-invasive cervical disease cervical cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Study Diagnostic Efficacy `` Real Time '' Niris 1300e Optical Coherence Tomography ( OCT ) Imaging System Management Pre-invasive Invasive Neoplasia Uterine Cervix
DOC.detailed_description: B . Specific Aims 1 . Primary . To determine sensitivity , specificity , positive negative predictive value Niris 1300e OCT enhance gynecologic examination ( VIA-OCT vs.colposcopy-biopsy ) detection lesion equal great cervical intraepithelial neoplasia II ( CIN II ) cancer `` real time '' clinical evaluation . 2 . Secondary . To examine ease use Niris 1300e OCT real time clinical set order assess potential application `` see treat '' `` single episode care '' clinic visit .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Female subject > 18 year age 2 . Subject must voluntarily sign Patient Informed Consent Form specific study . 3 . Subject must physically mentally willing comply study requirement , especially conduct colposcopy exam . 4 . Participant must attend Center Cervical Diagnosis . 1 . Based clinical history , physical exam patient presentation , subject unable provide adequate inform consent and/or comply study requirement . 2 . Subject prisoner . 3 . Subject pregnant . 4 . Subject hysterectomy 5 . Subject receive prior pelvic radiotherapy .
